title: BEWARE BLACK HOLE OF DEBT
body: FINANCE MINISTER Dr Nigel Clarke is calling for more public-private partnerships to help Jamaica navigate away from what he calls the black hole of a looming regional debt . Citing the latest IMF World Economic Outlook, released earlier this month, Clarke said remains in the top handful of most indebted countries in the Western Hemisphere even after bringing its debt ratio down to 94 per cent of GDP. “We were the third most indebted country out of 35, and the other two that were ahead of us were island states of the Caribbean. We’ve been so far out of mainstream for so long in this hot that we don’t realise what hot is any more,” the minister said during the Private Sector Organisation of ’s virtual economic forum, PSOJ Roadmap to 2.0, held online on Thursday.
